column4: guys, wtf is up with the latest ubuntu firefox release? anyone else getting problems?
randomly crashing, it broke the first time i ran it (due to loads of extensions no doubt, but it's also crashing on a clean profile)
that would be great, if i could get to about:config without launching the browser ;)
odd, it's running fine here for three days...
however, I have a similar random crash on tbird (which I didn't yet relase), I'm investigating
yes, but it's on my disk for three days (not completely patched, though)
I wanted to test the complete update for at least a day
lemme figure out that tbird crash, I have reasons to assume that it is exactly the same cause; however, I can't reproduce the ffox crash
is it a new version of tbird too? as i'm not getting any issues with that at all
I'm still preparing it
it's a PITA, there are so many and so big patches, I already worked on it for two days
have you discovered the problem with firefox yet?
I'm at it, no
now you'll get 1.0.6 in hoary
when?
i can't see firefox 1.0.6 yet :(
http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/m/mozilla-firefox/ <- it's right there
do i have to uninstall 'firefox' and the other backports packages i installed in order to see mozilla-firefox 1.0.6?
oh, of course; I never looked at backports, and we can't support them
so obviously the backports guys messed up the package name
but it still seems strange that i can't see 1.0.6 in synaptic even though i've got backports disabled?
update the lists first?
